alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 19 at 10:56AM MST until December 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 8 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...La Crosse, Uniontown, Tekoa, Genesee, Plummer, Moscow, Rosalia, Oakesdale, Colfax, Pullman, and Potlatch. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. For the Wind Chill Watch, from late Tuesday night through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Periods of moderate to heavy snow will be possible Tuesday evening and night impacting the Tuesday evening commute. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
